metadata.title: CVE-2019-18790 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in channels/chan_sip.c in Sangoma Asterisk 13.x before 13.29.2, 16.x before 16.6.2, and 17.x before 17.0.1, and Certified Asterisk 13.21 before cert5. A SIP request can be sent to Asterisk that can change a SIP peer's IP address. A REGISTER does not need to occur, and calls can be hijacked as a result. The only thing that needs to be known is the peer's name; authentication details such as passwords do not need to be known. This vulnerability is only exploitable when the nat option is set to the default, or auto_force_rport.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-18790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.10.0~dfsg-1').
